Description: Scabbard-chape; cast bronze with an oval opening, embossed on both faces with birds back to back in foliage; one hole on one face and two on the other for rivets.
Curator's comments: This object was initially registered as "medieval Persian" despite being found at Fustat in Egypt. Its place of manufacture is uncertain.
Acquisition notes: Registered as having been "found in the ruins of Old Cairo", i.e. Fustat.
